name: William Friar
text: They have a nice variety of bagels, cookies, croissants, and muffins (those were alphabetized, didja see that?).  They also have some soups and sandwiches.   Some days they are understaffed.  The coffee is made behind the counter, then placed out front, so it may be cold.

name: fu ne
text:
I had a coupon for “free, any beverage”.  I ordered a cup of mocha latte with the coupon but a lady there said that the coupon was only for soft drinks and coffee not a special one. I could tell that she did not welcome a customer with a coupon.  Her altitude and face expression seemed  to  look down on me.   If the employees do not appreciate having customers with coupons, the company should not provide any coupons in public.
I do not recommend going there with any discount deals.

name: Melissa McDaniel
text: Terrible, terrible service, expensive, very, very small portions.... The staff act like they DO NOT want to serve you!!!! Never again, I will starve before I go to this place again!

name: Deneece Groves
text: Healthy options. Open early and very late which is really helpful when you are with someone in the hospital and never know when you can slip away to eat. Delicious food.

name: Tamara M
text: Chicken salad was terrible ! No flavor ! The description sounded DELICIOUS ! But it was like chicken dumped from a can. Took it back, showed her and the cafe lady said " oh yeah  . The avocado dressing got left off." She made me another ( of course I had to wait. Again. ) I think they were short handed. And this was about 3:00p.m. I appreciated her trying to fix the problem. But the second sandwich was bland, too. A waste of $ 7.00.

name: Hypnotica 713
text: The food that I had there was excellent.  I very much enjoyed the sandwich I had made, even though they did not have the stuff to make the first two sandwiches I asked for.  The muffins were the bomb! Little pricy, but what do you expect at a hospital?

name: Jarret Ramsdale
text: So, working at and for UAB has its perks and one of them is Au Bon Pain. We are able to get free water(best water in the whole hospital, plus refills) and their great selection of food items and drinks, from pastries to sandwiches and salads.

name: ghoulie doodles
text: Horrible service!!!! You want it, this is the place to come!!! As a employee at mobile infirmary I was shocked!!! An employee made two customers sandwich, WITH HER SAME GLOVES CHECKED THE PEOPLE OUT TOOK THERE MONEY AND COUNTED BACK CHANGE AND CAME BACK TO MAKE MY SANDWICH WITH SAME GLOVES!!!  I asked her to change them and she did but had to ROLL HER EYES FIRST!!! I guess if I would have changed a patient and made her food she would not of minded???

name: April Thrasher
text: Rudest employees! Mobile Infirmary should do something about them. While purchasing my coffee, the cashier said "I can tell somebody is gonna piss me off today!". Then I came in later to purchase a sandwich and she didn't even speak, she just gave me evil looks. Pathetic service

name: Jasmine
text: Their food is good but they are over-priced.

name: Ric Henderson
text: Good food considering it's in a hospital. Excellent desserts too.

name: alaina moore
text: Very rude people. Would not accept my coupon that was valid for today.  Highly disappointed the way they treated  and will never come back

name: Jonathan New
text: Very nice staff in and out quick and food was awesome

name: The MadGilder
text: All around pretty subpar. The coffee is consistently the worst in the area.

name: Dee Tyson
text: OK if you are into really healthy food which I'm not . Very pricy but you can expect this at a hospital.

name: Walter Anderson
text: Server grab a pen to take my order with gloves. Then proceeded to fix my sandwich. No thanks you can keep it

name: memori maxwell
text: They are rude and food was over cooked
